title: Ping Problems
body: I generally get a fairly normal rate of 60-90 ping however the past two to three days my ping has straight skyrocketed to high 300s, I do not know what is causing this problem and would like some help.

replies.body:
Sudden changes in latency (ping) are often caused by ISP routing changes in how your connection reaches the servers. Before we investigate into your route, we'll need to ensure local network settings aren't exacerbating this issue. I strongly recommend working through the steps in our [connection troubleshooting guide](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) as a first step.

Let me know if those steps caused any positive change to your latency.

Ping is usually based on your own internet, however, sometimes the Riot servers do tend to have their problems. Make sure that you have nothing that would be taking up a ton of your bandwidth before you play (I.E. Streaming services such as Twitch or Youtube, any sort of download, etc). These can cause major ping spikes, from experience on my side. Check to see if anyone else is on your internet at all, as they could be doing something.

On the other hand, looking at another post from the support section, other players are having the same issue, so it's very possible that the Riot servers are having troubles with something right now. Keep updated with other posts to see what's up and to see if anything that was posted could help you out.
